direction.raw_text: : April 27, 1973 All is quiet outside this suburban school on a sunny Friday afternoon. Cars idle in the driveway awaiting the three o'clock onslaught of liberated children. Two faded yellow buses stand ready. The lull is shattered by the CLANGING of the final BELL. A swarm of children pours out the door and down the broad front steps, scattering across the lawn toward the cars and the buses. Moving slowly through the crowd, ROBIN and ALEX HAMMOND, nine-year-old identical twins, appear at the doorway.. Attractive, dark-haired children, they seem more sub- dued than the others. As they walk quietly down the stairs, Robin lags behind, staring at a boy teasing a girl nearby. He is NICK MCBRIDE, eleven years old, two grades ahead of Robin and the most popular boy in school. The pretty girl laughing at his antics is KIM HAMMOND, also eleven, Robin's older sister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, Robin.

direction.raw_text: N-n-n-no, Alex. Let's w-w-wait.

direction.raw_text: Robin? Robin smiles and takes Kim's hand. They walk along the road, kicking rocks and swinging their bookbags. Sud- denly Kim halts.

direction.raw_text: Oh, damn! Robin looks up in surprise.

direction.raw_text: Debbie was gonna lend me her new record. Look, you go on home by yourself. Tell Mom I'll be a little late. Before Robin can reply, Kim is hurrying away. (CONTINUED)

As she turns off the main road into a side street, Robin passes a construction site. The empty skeleton of a half-finished apartment building looms up above the dark shade trees. Hearing VOICES, Robin stops to investigate.

direction.raw_text: You'll never catch me. Hide your eyes, killer! As Nick turns his back, hiding his eyes against an ex- posed beam, the children scatter through the structure. Robin watches with mounting excitement as Nick finishes counting, and whirls around.

direction.raw_text: The killer is coming for you! He moves into the building, chanting "Kill, kill.," in a low monotone. As he disappears from view, Robin cau- tiously edges out of the bushes and moves up to the building.

LAUGHTER FOLLOWS im- mediately and Robin hears Kelly's VOICE TAKING UP the chant. As the three "killers" move through the vast structure searching for Wendy, "KILL, KILT" ECHOES off the walls and hardwood floors. Robin cautiously steps out of the doorway into the im- mense unfinished lobby. Ominous shadows slash across the floor as the excited girl listens to the relentless

Flushed with excitement, she imagines herself a "killer" searching for Wendy. As she moves past an empty room, she hears a SOFT GIGGLE. Robin stops and listens care- fully. Once again she hears the GIGGLE, LOUDER this time, coming from nearby. Stepping to a doorway, she leans around the corner and peers inside. In the darkness she can see nothing. Gathering her courage, she quietly slips into the room. The room appears empty but a closet door is slightly ajar. As Robin approaches, she hears a FAINT GASP from behind her. Whirling around, she sees Wendy crouched behind a cardboard box in the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better not tell! Before Robin can react, she hears a THUD from above. Looking up, she sees Nick's head appear through an opening in the ceiling. Seeing Robin, then Wendy standing in the corner, he howls in triumph. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: Here, killers, here! Nick's head disappears from the opening and Robin hears the POUNDING of RUNNING FEET.

direction.raw_text: Now you've done it, you idiot! The CHANTING GROWS LOUDER as the "killers" rush towards the room. Trapped, Wendy looks frantically for an es- cape but finds nothing. Turning around suddenly, she grins at Robin, a cruel, hard expression on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill, kill, kill... Picking up the chant, Wendy begins to advance on Robin. Terrified, Robin turns and rushes out of the room, bowling over Nick in the doorway. Delighted that the game is continuing with a new victim, he follows Wendy in pursuit of Robin. Robin flees down the long, dark corridor, "KILL, KILL ECHOING in her wake. As she rounds a corner, Jude ap- pears, looming up in front of her. Robin screams and sprints in the opposite direction. Kelly leaps out of a doorway and grabs for her, but Robin, swinging out blindly, escapes the "killer."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darting into the large room, Robin collapses against a wall, gasping for breath. As her eyes adjusts to the darkness, she spies a rickety ladder extending through a hole in the floor to the basement below. Stacked up- right near the opening are several sheets of window glass. Before Robin can make a move towards the lad- der, she hears a horrible SCREECH and Wendy appears in the doorway, a vicious look on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Killers, here! Wendy advances. Terrified, Robin begins to back away.

direction.raw_text: N-n-n-no! (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: Nick, Jude and Kelly appear in the doorway, chanting "Kill, kill." Moving quickly, Robin grabs the ladder and starts down into the basement, careful not to knock over the sheets of glass stacked near the opening. Peering into the pitch-black basement, Robin hesitates. But as Wendy and her fellow "killers" close in on her, Robin continues down the ladder. Wendy rushes up and grabs the ladder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: P-p-please! Wendy grins and shakes the ladder. The chanting is deafening. Robin hugs the wooden slats. Wendy shakes even harder. Robin screams. Nick moves around Wendy to get a better look. He accidentally bumps the glass stacked next to the opening. The sudden movement is just enough to dislodge a razor-sharp pane of glass and send it hurtling down directly at Robin. The girl's last scream catches in her throat as the glass slices through her neck. She is instantly decapitated. Horrified, Wendy watches the glass and the body crash to the concrete basement floor. Kelly screams. Jude sobs loudly. Nick can only stare in shock. Finally, he manages to speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We gotta get somebody quick! Nick starts to go. Wendy instantly whirls, grabs his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you crazy? They'll put us in jail! Confused, Nick cannot reply. The other girls grow silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we tell anyone, they'll say it's our fault. Who'd believe it was an accident? Nick starts to protest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to me! (MORE) (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: We'll go home now and never ever tell anyone. They'll think it was an accident. 1,10 one but us will ever know. She looks at each of them. They are still too numb to respond.

direction.raw_text: I won't tell.

direction.raw_text: Good. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: With a final glance down at Robin's mutiliated body, Wendy quickly ushers her shocked friends out of the room. As their FOOTSTEPS ECHO away across the hardwood floor, there is a terrible silence. Then, starting very quietly, more FOOTSTEPS are HEARD, this time a single person approaching the ladder from above. The FOOT- STEPS STOP and a deep, black shadow falls across the ladder; HEAVY BREATHING punctuates the oppressive quiet, growing louder and more anguished.

direction.raw_text: We slowly TILT UP TO the tortured features of RAYMOND HAMMOND, Robin's father. A handsome, dark-haired man in his late thirties, he teaches history at George Winston High School. Wracked with grief, he stands near the opening in the floor and watches as two Paramedics bring up the body of his daughter from the dark basement. A young Policeman standing nearby raises the white sheet covering Robin's remains. Hammond steps up and gazes at his daughter's decapitated body. A look of absolute horror and revulsion freezes on his face; what he sees he will never forget. Paralyzed, Hammond barely hears the CAR PULLING UP in front of the construction site. He turns and looks out the window.

Stifling a giggle, she looks up to see Kim and Vicki across the aisle, eagerly awaiting her reply. Jude tears out part of a page from her biology book and scrawls her answer. direction.raw_text: . HALLWAY (WELLER'S CLASSROOM) - DAY 80 Kim comes down the hallway and stops at the door. There's a piece of paper with a hastily scrawled mes- sage taped there. It heads: "Detention Postponed Until Monday -- EMERGENCY! Weller."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Did it work? Kim is startled, turns. Vicki and Jude and approach- ing. Vicki hurries to the door, reads the note. (CONTINUED) ai.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It worked! She lets out a whoop, embraces Jude. Kim stands back, somehow less impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GYM - DAY 81 Several students are putting last-minute touches on the decor as Kim comes in. Huge speakers are being hoisted on pulleys to hang from the ceiling. A vast, raised platform covers much of the gym floor, its plexiglass surface designed to be illuminated from below. Perched on a ladder, Weller is hanging shimmering silver strips while Henri-Anne Benton supervises from the disco floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Careful, Monty... A little higher... (sees Kim and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad you could make it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something came up... (looks at Weller) 'Afternoon, Mr. Weller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, hello, Miss... Hammond. I was just... uh... Henri-Anne mercifully interrupts him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get started. (CALLS OUT) Nick! Nick pokes his head out of the sound booth set on a platform near the stage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Onstage! Tell Alex we're ready. Alex emerges from the booth. DAVY MATLOCK, a pudgy, fifteen-year-old sophomore and Alex's technical assis- tant, leans out behind him. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All set, Miss Benton. Just have Davy roll the tapes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wonderful. You can be Mr. Hanunond for the rehearsal! Alex groans. Kim smiles as Nick joins her. She takes his hand, clutches it. They start to walk away, talk- ing quietly. Nick puts his arm around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick! Kim! Come with me. Henri-Anne bounds up onto the stage. Kim and Nick fol- low her behind the curtain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GYM (BACKSTAGE) - DAY 82 Henri-Anne takes Kim to one of the wings of the dark cluttered area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll wait here... (looks around for
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick? Nick silently creeps from behind a partition and moves up directly behind Henri-Anne. He mimes choking her, a crazed expression on his face. Kim has to laugh at his clowning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scary place!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to stand up here tonight, not me. If you don't know what to do, you'll look the fool! Nick glances at Kim. She shrugs. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come along. Nick follows her to the opposite wing. Kim cannot see them from her position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (continuing; calls out) Can you hear me, Kim?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Kim leans against a wall, gazing around at her gloomy surroundings. She does not hear the WHISPERED CONVER- SATION coming from behind a nearby partition. She does not see Wendy and Lou lurking there, watching her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, Alex, start the tape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of the SPEAKERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen for your cue, king and queen...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is HEARD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Start walking -- slowly! Kim begins to cross the stage. She smiles when she spots Nick. The curtain slowly opens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The King and Queen of the George Winston High School Junion-Senior Prom for 1980 -- Nick McBride and Kim Hammond! They meet backstage center and turn towards the parting curtain. Henri-Anne stands at the front of the stage, her hand resting on Alex's shoulder, as Kim and Nick proceed downstage. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These two seniors were selected by their fellow students as the most popular boy and girl in the class..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Kim as they
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit! Kim smiles. Peeking out from behind the curtain, Wendy turns to Lou.

direction.raw_text: Bullshit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shhh!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick is a three-sport letterman and president of the Key Club. He plans to attend State University in the fall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because he can't get in anywhere else!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kim is the head cheerleader and ranked number one on the girls' tennis team. She hopes to become a teacher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If she ever graduates... Nick and Kim stop downstage center.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, Alex. Self-consciously, Alex stumbles up to Kim and pretends to give her a bouquet of roses. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it, Alex. Now kiss her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My sister?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alex! Alex awkwardly kisses Kim on the cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now the king.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kiss the king?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the mouth! Kim laughs at Alex's discomfort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shake hands... They shake.

direction.raw_text: Alex, step back... Alex moves next to her.

direction.raw_text: Kim and Nick, start down the.. (looks at the

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (continuing; to the
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in the back timidly responds. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll find them, Miss Benton. Henri-Anne turns back to Nick and Kim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll descend the steps... Nick and Kim climb down from the stage.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait for the spotlights and your music cue, then dance... (SIGHS) It'll be beautiful!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HALLWAY - DAY 83 Kim strides down the empty corridor, flushed and ex- cited from the rehearsal. Arriving at her father's of- fice, she flings open the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OFFICE - DAY 84 Kim enters and surveys the apparently empty office. Hearing GRUNTS and GROANS from behind the desk, Kim steps around and sees Adele Cooper stretched across the floor. The secretary is practicing her "Rainbow" exer- cise, arching her body towards the ceiling while keep- ing her hands and feet on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? Adele twists her head around to look at Kim. Her "Rainbow" collapses. Spinning around, Adele sits cross-legged on the floor and smiles at Kim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... I've calmed down a bit... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adele launches into another contortion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This works for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has my father been back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nope. Haven't seen him all afternoon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he didn't leave a message?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Strange... He usually gives me a ride home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me finish and I'll give you a lift.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, but I can walk. Kim starts to leave, turning around at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guess I won't be seeing you again. Standing on her head, Adele smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guess again. Three different students asked me to the prom tonight... I thought you had to be enrolled!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not with any of them. Know any good-looking fathers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll keep my eyes open. See you later. She exits as Adele slowly lowers her legs to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HALLWAY - DAY 85 Jude approaches her locker, stops. There's a picture taped to her locker door, her picture, ripped out of the Winston High Yearbook. She looks at it, reaches up and pulls it off the door. She winces, looks at her finger. It's bleeding. She looks at the picture. There's a tiny sliver of glass embedded in it. Jude hears SOMEONE COMING. She turns to see Kelly com- ing toward her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jude... look... She has something in her hand. It's a photo of her, a, Yearbook photo with the same torn edges. Jude holds up her version.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SHOWER ROOM - DAY 86 The DOOR CREAKS open. A light is flicked on. Sykes stands there, a broom and a big waste-pan in his hands. He stares at the broken mirror with its center hole and its missing wedge. He shuffles across the floor and starts to clean up the debris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HAMMONDS' HOUSE - DUSK 87 The split-level suburban residence sits on a tree-lined street in an older, middle-class neighborhood. Walking up the driveway, Kim hears a LOUD THUD from behind the house. As the SOUND CONTINUES, Kim walks around back to investigate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HAMONDS ' BACKYARD - DUSK 88 Stepping around the corner of the house, Kim sees her father furiously chopping an old stump in the flower garden. (CONTINUED) / l.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hammond's axe slashes into the rotten wood, sending splinters flying in all directions. Kim watches him work. He appears angry and upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. Oblivious, Hammond buries the axe in the stump. Kim moves around to face him. When he sees her, Hammond jumps, startled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't hear you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. Wiping the sweat from his forehead, Hammond struggles to catch his breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm getting too old for this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you doing it now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother's been hounding me to get it done... You got nay message?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told that woman to tell you I had a meeting and couldn't drive you home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your secretary?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Idiot!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I liked her. Hammond angrily jerks the axe from the stump. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This thing with your mother... Have you seen her yet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. How is she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One minute she's depressed, the next she's bubbling over like a child... She wants to go with me tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not so sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think getting dressed up and going out might be good for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's had a bad day, Kim. I'm not sure she can handle it... See if you can talk to her. Hammond picks up the axe and sends it crashing into the stump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN - DUSK 89 Kim enters from the backyard. Looking around, she no- tices that nothing is being prepared for dinner. Curious, she moves toward the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVING ROOM - DUSK 90 Vivian is arranging fresh roses on the mantel shrine when Kim enters. The girl stands for several seconds watching her mother before she speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Mom. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 90 VIVIAN (WITHOUT TURNING AROUND) Hello, Robin. Don't eat anything. Dinner's almost ready. Disturbed, Kim frowns and slowly crosses the room to her mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing's cooking, Mom. You must've forgotten. Slipping out of her reverie, Vivian turns around to face Kim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.. I don't know what I was thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't matter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you seen the new satin pantsuit I'm wearing? Vivian smiles at her daughter. Kim studies her for a long moment, then leans over and kisses her on the cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll be beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HALLWAY - HAMMONDS' HOUSE - DUSK As Kim walks down the hallway, she notices that Alex's door is closed. She enters her bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BEDROOM - DUSK 92 Kim crosses the room and switches ON her RADIO. ROCK MUSIC is HEARD as she tosses her books onto the desk and moves to the closet. She carefully pulls out her prom dress, a mid-length, off-the-shoulder gown in a white, clinging material. Holding it up against her body, she inspects the gown in the full-length mirror on the closet door. Watching her reflection, Kim twirls around, hugging the gowm to her body. Satis- fied, she gently lays the go%.m on her bed. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kim begins to undress. Outside, the twilight shadows deepen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the VINDOM, a slight movement is SEAN among the trees; suddenly, a dark figure becomes VISIBLE, ap- proaching.the window. Kim does not notice the figure as she finishes undressing. She wraps herself in a robe and sits at her dressing table. Putting her hair up, she does not see the shadowy figure peering inside. When Kim stands up, the figure slips away from the window. As she crosses the room, the face reappears, hidden by the shadows, watching her enter the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BEDROOM - DUSK 93 Wearing only a bra and panties, Wendy is sprawled across her bed, talking on the telephone. A black silk gown is draped across her legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into the receiver) What I'm wearing now?... Oh, tonight! (smiles, gently stroking the gown) You'll find out soon enough. (STIFFENS) Now, are we all set?... It better. I don't want her to ever forget tonight!... Okay, 'bye. Wendy hangs up the receiver and glances at her night table. A photograph of a grinning Nick McBride stares back. Wendy smiles and caresses her gown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BEDROOM - NIGHT 94 Seated at her dressing table, Kim puts the final touch- es on her makeup. Her hair is swept up and back, fall- ing in soft waves to her shoulders. Wearing the rav- ishing white gown, she looks older and very beautiful. Vivian's VOICE is HEARD from down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Kim! Vivian comes in looking anxious and flustered. She's dressed in an elegant black satin pantsuit. Kim turns, looks at her. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, it looks great... Vivian doesn't seem to hear her. She's rummaging through her purse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kim, have you got any of my makeup?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... I never...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That deep red lipstick, you remember? You liked it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't take it without asking you... Vivian's very wound up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was on my dressing table, I set it aside... She's looking around Kim's room as if she expects to see it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why does this always happen at the last minute? Hammond's VOICE bellows from downstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) let's go, we can't be late...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I set it aside... She heads for the door, stops, looks fully at Kim for the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look lovely, dear. She goes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DOWNSTAIRS HALL - NIGHT 95 Hammond stands in front of a hall mirror, straightening his bow tie. He seems agitated, nervous. He turns as Vivian starts down the stairs. He looks surprised at her outfit. There's a certain similarity between it and his own formal suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God, we're going to look like twins. Vivian stops dead, looks at him. Hammond forces a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm joking, Vi, it's beautiful.._ C'mon... She hesitates, then comes down to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you I'd bought it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course you did. He opens the door for her. She pauses to check herself in the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: we've got to go. He puts an arm around her, kisses her gently on the cheek. She just stares at herself in the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOUSE - NIGHT 96 Hammond takes Vivian's arm as they step outside, walk toward the car in the driveway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKED CAR - POV 97 Someone is watching Hammond and Vivian from a car parked across and just down the street. A shadow moves in the foreground, in the front seat of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOUSE 98 Hammond guides his wife to their family car, opens the passenger door for her_ He looks past her, down the street, sees a car parked there. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A streetlight reflecting off its windshield prevents him from seeing inside. Vivian interrupts his speculations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going back to change. She turns back to the house. Hammond holds on to her arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vi... there's no time...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going to look ridiculous!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't look ridiculous, you look fine...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKED CAR - POV 99 The figure in the front seat watches the confrontation in the Hammond driveway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOUSE 100 Hammond takes Vivian by the shoulders, faces her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vi.. this is a big night for the school, it's a big night for me... I know how you're feeling... I understand... It's difficult for all of us... But we've got to make a special effort, Vi... We can't let the... terrible memories of this day affect us... That may seem cold and... insensitive to you, but it's the way it has to be.. He pauses, staring down at his wife. She's holding his gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, Vi, if you think it's going to be too difficult for you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't want me to go. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Certainly I want you to go, just saying...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't think I can do it... You think I'll embarrass you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! I don't... believe me..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why are you saying these things?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vi... I just.. He's trying to stay calm, to keep the lid on. She's on the verge of tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry... I didn't mean to upset you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You treat me like a child! I'm your wife! She glares at him. He releases her from his grip, ges- tures toward the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get going... He walks around to the driver's door. Vivian stares after him with hard cold eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKED CAR - POV 101 The figure in the parked car watches as Hammond starts up the car, waits for Vivian to get in, backs out of the driveway, and moves off down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARKED CAR 102 The figure climbs out of his car, gazes at the fading taillights of the Hammond car. The figure is Nick McBride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BEDROOM - NIGHT 103 Kim reaches for a small bottle of cologne. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As she gently tracks the perf me across her skin, she is startled by another reflection in her mirror. Whirling around, she sees Alex. Standing up, she pir- ouettes and curtsies before her brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well? Alex gapes, stunned by his sister's appearance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amazing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look almost like a woman!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks! She picks up her corsage from her dressing table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to help or just leer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're my sister... I'll leer!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pin this on me, you creep, late. Alex takes the corsage. As he attaches the bright red flower on her gown, she playfully dabs perfume on his neck. He pulls back, pricking himself on the pin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shouldn't have pulled away... The DOORBELL RINGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's him! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction
